text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bahraini press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Aluminium Bahrain to build a new research centre at a cost of one million dinars.
- South Africa is to close its Bahrain embassy, opened in October 1994, later this year but will maintain trade and other bilateral relations.
- No major changes in gold sales figure in Bahrain despite a 12-year record slump in prices.
- Bahrain plans to build a 75,000 dinar utility centre for elderly and handicapped.
- Bahrain's emir commissions new frigate, Sabha, which arrived from the United States earlier in July.
- Bank of Bahrain and Kuwait posts a 5.5 million dinar net profit in the first half of 1997, up 14 percent from a year earlier.
- Gulf Arab officials to discuss later this month in Bahrain 10 projects aimed at smoothing recruitment of nationals.
